Description: FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: L23AS00192FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT:  THIS WOULD PROVIDE STATISTICAL ANALYSES OF STATUS AND TRENDS OF RANGELANDS ACROSS THE BLM FOR NATIONAL LEVEL REPORTING.  THEY WILL PROVIDE AN ANNUAL REPORT WITH INFORMATION AS DETERMINED RELEVANT BETWEEN THE BLM AND IOWA STATE THROUGH SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT. 1. STATISTICAL SUPPORT TO THE BLM LANDSCAPE MONITORING FRAMEWORK PROJECT, INCLUDING SURVEY DESIGN AND ANALYSIS. 2. ELECTRONIC DATA CAPTURE, DATA MANAGEMENT AND QUALITY ASSURANCE QUALITY CONTROL FOR  THE BLM LANDSCAPE MONITORING FRAMEWORK PROJECT. 3. KNOWLEDGE TRANSFER OF STATISTICAL AND DATA MANAGEMENT APPROACHES AND PROCEDURES. 4. YEARLY REPORTS INCLUDING RAW DATA AND ESTIMATES FOR A STANDARD SET OF POLYGONS.GOALS   ESTIMATED TIMELINES: A)SAMPLE SELECTION: SUMMER OF YEAR BEFORE DATA COLLECTION B)PROTOCOL AND INSTRUCTION DEVELOPMENT: SUMMER TO FALL OF YEAR BEFORE DATA COLLECTION C)SURVEY SYSTEMS DEVELOPMENT DATA COLLECTION SOURCE MATERIALS: FALL AND WINTER BEFORE DATA COLLECTION D)FIELD TRAINING: FEBRUARY TO JUNE OF CALENDAR YEAR E)  FIELD DATA COLLECTION SUPPORT: FEBRUARY TO OCTOBER OF CALENDAR YEAR F)STATISTICAL PROCESSING AND ESTIMATION: AFTER DATA COLLECTION IS COMPLETE THROUGH THE NEXT SUMMER G)AUGUST IN THE YEAR AFTER DATA COLLECTION MEASURES: A)NATIONAL SAMPLE SURVEY DESIGN B)PROTOCOL AND INSTRUCTION DEVELOPMENT C)SUPPORT AND TRAINING FOR DATA COLLECTION D)   STATISTICAL PROCESSING AND REPORT(S)

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: L23AS00192FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT:  THE PURPOSE OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE LANDCART IN CONTINUED COLLABORATION WITH THE BLM.  LANDCART ALLOWS PREDICTIONS OF RANGELAND INDICATORS IN PLACES AND TIMES WHERE THERE ARE NO FIELD DATA, ALLOWS DATA EXPORT, AND CONDUCTS STATISTICALLY-APPROPRIATE STATISTICAL TESTS IN COMPARING DIFFERENT AREAS, OR TIMESERIES.  LANDCART BENEFITS THE BLM STAKEHOLDERS BY SUPPORT DATA-DRIVEN LAND MANAGEMENT DECISION MAKING.  IT IS A PRODUCT THAT IS USED DAILY BY THE BLM AND PUBLIC USERS AND COULD BE RELIED ON FOR NEW PROPOSED PUBLIC LAND RULE.  1. MAINTENANCE OF LANDCART TO ENSURE ONGOING AVAILABILITY OF ITS CAPABILITIES FOR BLM PERSONNEL FOR DECISION MAKING. 2. IMPROVEMENT OF LANDCART RANGELAND INDICATOR PREDICTIONS USING NEW DATASETS AND OR PREDICTION ALGORITHMS.  3. CONTINUE INTEGRATION OF LANDCART PREDICTION CAPABILITIES FOR BLM LANDS IN ALASKA.  4. WORK WITH BLM TO DEVELOP USE CASES FOR LANDCART.  5. CONTINUED COLLABORATION WITH BLM ON IMPROVEMENTS TO LANDCART FOR BLM USE.

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: L23AS00192FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: THE SRM HAS AN ANNUAL MEETING THAT BRINGS TOGETHER A DIVERSE GROUP OF APPROXIMATELY 1,500 ATTENDEES FROM FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS  UNIVERSITIES  RANCHING COMMUNITIES  ENVIRONMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS  AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES TO PARTICIPATE IN TECHNICAL SESSIONS ADDRESSING ISSUES THAT AFFECT BLM-MANAGED RANGELANDS TODAY AND IN THE FUTURE. THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE DIRECT LINKS TO PROFESSIONALS WITHIN THE FIELD OF RANGELAND SCIENCE WITH EXPERTISE AND PRACTICAL KNOWLEDGE IN A WIDE ARRAY OF CURRENT RANGE TOPICS, OPPORTUNITIES TO INTERACT WITH A DIVERSE GROUP OF RANGELAND MANAGEMENT PROFESSIONALS AND INTERESTED STUDENTS TO RECRUIT ALL IN ONE LOCATION, WHICH ENHANCES RECRUITMENT EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS. ADDITIONALLY, SUPPORT OF THE GOOD GRAZING MAKES CENT  EDUCATIONAL FORUM WILL HELP AMPLIFY SUCCESS STORIES IN LAND MANAGEMENT AND WITHIN THE BLM.   SRM MEETING SPONSORSHIP INCLUDES PRESS RELEASES, MAJOR GATHERING RECOGNITION, PREMIER BOOTH SPACE, DESIGNATED ROOM SPACE FOR OUTREACH, RECRUITMENT, AND OR TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES, AMPLIFIED VISIBILITY, WEBPAGE RECOGNITION, FOUR COMPLIMENTARY REGISTRATIONS, AND PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS. GOOD GRAZING MAKES CENT  SPONSORSHIP INCLUDES TITLE SPONSORSHIP RECOGNITION BROUGHT TO YOU BY THE BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT WITH LINKABLE LOGO, PRESENTING SPONSORSHIP RECOGNITION, BANNER AD, FOUR CUSTOMIZED SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS, FACEBOOK LIVE EVENT, WEBSITE PARTNERS LINKED LOGO, PARTNERS MEETING, MEETING IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE GOOD GRAZING MAKES CENT  PRESENTATION, AND BLM EMPLOYEE ACCESS TO GGMC PROGRAM MATERIALS. GOALS   ESTIMATED TIMELINES: A) ALL PRESENTING SPONSOR BENEFITS OF ANNUAL MEETING SPONSORSHIP B) PRESENTING SPONSOR BENEFITS OF GGMC CONTENT (LIVE, RECORDED, SOCIAL MEDIA, WEBSITE) C) OUTREACH AND RECRUIT FOR BLM EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. MEASURES: A)TRACKING ATTENDANCE OF ANNUAL MEETING B)TRACKING LIKES, WATCHES, OR LOGINS FOR ONLINE CONTENT  C)FILLING VACANCIES: SEASONAL, PERMANENT, INTERNSHIPS, PARTNER VACANCIES.
HARNEY SWCD HAS A MISSION TO CONSERVE, PROTECT AND DEVELOP SOIL, WATER, AND OTHER RELATED RESOURCES FOR THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND ECONOMICAL BENEFIT OF THE PEOPLE OF HARNEY COUNTY.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO RESTORE AND REHABILITATE RANGELAND IN SOUTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO  THE PROJECT WILL TARGET NOXIOUS WEEDS AND INVASIVE SPECIES OF MESQUITE, CREOSOTE, JUNIPER, AND SALT CEDAR IN PRIORITY LANDSCAPES AND WATERSHEDS WHICH HAVE SIGNIFICANT INVASIVE SHRUB ENCROACHMENT INTO THE DESERT GRASSLAND, AND RIPARIAN AREAS  ELIMINATING TARGETED INVASIVE SPECIES WILL ALLOW NATIVE GRASSES AND FORBS TO FLOURISH, THIS WILL RESTORE BIODIVERSITY TO THE SITES, ENHANCE CANDIDATE SPECIES HABITAT FOR THE LESSER PRAIRIE CHICKEN AND SAND DUNE LIZARD AND THE FEDERALLY LISTED APLOMANDO FALCON  RANGELAND RESTORATION BEGINS WITH TREATMENT OF INVASIVE AND NOXIOUS WEEDS AND SHRUBS WHICH HAVE CHOKED OUT NATIVE GRASSLANDS  MUCH OF THE LANDSCAPE WILL REBOUND WITH HEALTHY GRASSLAND UPON THE REMOVAL OF THE INVASIVE SHRUBS AND WEEDS, SOME AREAS WILL REQUIRE ENHANCEMENT OF HABITATS THROUGH INTRODUCTION OF NATIVE PLANTS AND SEED  ADDITIONAL BENEFITS WILL INCREASE WATER FLOW AND WATER QUALITY DUE TO INCREASED INFILTRATION AND DECREASE EROSION, THESE RESTORED LANDSCAPES WILL IMPROVE HABITAT FOR WILDLIFE, NATIVE AND DOMESTIC SPECIES  THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO ALLOW RECLAMATION OF MATERIAL SITE PITS PADS ROADS ASSOCIATED WITH ORPHAN AND LEGACY OIL AND GAS DEVELOPMENT, REDUCTION OF HABITAT FRAGMENTATION, STABILIZE AND REHABILITATION OF DISTURBED AREAS, AND EROSION CONTROL DUE TO DISTURBED AREAS BEING RECLAIMED  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE INVENTORYING AND SURVEYING PROJECT AREAS, INCLUDING DISCOVERY OF ARCHAEOLOGICAL AND THREATENED AND ENDANGERED  TAND E  SPECIES SITES WHICH WOULD REQUIRE CLEARANCES OR SPECIAL TREATMENTS, MONITORING TREATED AREAS TO ASSESS EFFICACY OF TREATMENTS AND COORDINATION OF MULTI JURISDICTIONAL AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS, RESPONSE PLANS TO PROPOSED TREATMENTS PUBLIC BENEFIT THIS PROJECT BENEFITS THE PUBLIC THROUGH PROVIDING HABITAT IMPROVEMENT ON PUBLIC LANDS USED FOR HUNTING, CAMPING, AND HIKING BY REDUCING THE COMPETITION FOR NATIVE GRASSES AND OTHER FORAGE FOR GRAZING  THE BLM WILL BENEFIT THROUGH ASSISTANCE WITH THEIR RANGELAND MANAGEMENT PROGRAM ON PUBLIC LANDS, INCREASED HABITAT AND WATERSHED HEALTH, RECLAIM ORPHAN AND LEGACY OIL AND GAS PADS ROADS MATERIAL PIT SITES, AND FUEL LOAD REDUCTION THROUGH CONTROL AND MANAGEMENT OF INVASIVE SPECIES AND NOXIOUS WEEDS

ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS MULTI YEAR AGREEMENT SUPPORT DATA STEWARDSHIP AND DATA DEVELOPMENT FOR THE NORTH SLOPE REGION OF ALASKA  THESE ACTIVITIES ASSIST AGENCIES, ORGANIZATIONS, AND THE PUBLIC IN EVALUATING THE EFFECTS OF PAST, ONGOING, AND ANTICIPATED DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES AND ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE ON THE NORTH SLOPE THE HIGH COSTS AND LOGISTICAL CONSTRAINTS ASSOCIATED WITH DATA COLLECTION ON THE NORTH SLOPE CAN BE SERIOUS IMPEDIMENTS TO THE COLLECTION OF NEW DATA  CONSEQUENTLY, DATA MANAGEMENT TOOLS THAT PROVIDE FOR THE ARCHIVAL, DISCOVERY AND DISTRIBUTION OF EXISTING DATA ARE IMPORTANT TO MAXIMIZE THE UTILITY OF THOSE DATA  IN ADDITION, DIVERSE, EXISTING DATASETS CAN BE COMPILED AND SYNTHESIZED TO DEVELOP NEW DATA PRODUCTS THAT FACILITATE ANALYSIS  EFFICIENT DATA MANAGEMENT CAN ENSURE THAT THE BEST AVAILABLE SCIENTIFIC DATA IS WIDELY AVAILABLE TO ENTITIES CONCERNED WITH RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ON THE NORTH SLOPE  PROPER DATA MANAGEMENT CAN FACILITATE COMMUNICATION WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES AND PROMOTE A BETTER AND COMMON UNDERSTANDING OF ONGOING RESEARCH ACTIVITIES, MANAGEMENT DECISION MAKING AND COMMUNITY CONCERNS THESE DATA MANAGEMENT SERVICES INCLUDE 1  NORTH SLOPE SCIENCE CATALOG  NSSC   THIS PUBLIC, WEB BASED INFORMATION PORTAL FACILITATES THE DISCOVERY, DISTRIBUTION AND PRESERVATION OF SCIENTIFIC DATA AND INFORMATION PRODUCTS FOR THE NORTH SLOPE REGION  ACCS CREATED AND MAINTAINS NSSC 2  NUIQSUT ENVIRONMENTAL INFORMATION WEBSITE  NEIW   THE NEIW WEBSITE WAS CREATED AND MAINTAINED BY ACCS AS A REQUIREMENT UNDER THE BLM RECORD OF DECISION  ROD  ASSOCIATED WITH GREATER MOOSES TOOTH 2  THIS WEBSITE IS A COLLABORATIVE EFFORT BY BLM, ACCS AND CONOCOPHILLIPS THAT PROVIDES PUBLIC ACCESS TO INFORMATION PRODUCTS DESCRIBING DEVELOPMENT AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS IN THE VICINITY OF THE NORTH SLOPE COMMUNITY OF NUIQSUT 3  NORTH SLOPE SCIENCE INITIATIVE WEBSITE  NSSI   ACCS CREATED AND MAINTAINS A WEBSITE THAT PROVIDES AN ORGANIZATIONAL DESCRIPTION OF THE NSSI AS WELL AS RELEVANT NSSI ADMINISTRATIVE DOCUMENTS AND PRODUCTS  THIS SITE ALSO PROVIDES ACCESS TO NSSC, NEIW AND OTHER INFORMATION PORTALS 4  DATA DEVELOPMENT  ACCS WILL IDENTIFY DATA GAPS AND DATA COMPILATION OPPORTUNITIES IN ORDER TO PROMOTE CREATION OF DATA PRODUCTS FOR THE NORTH SLOPE REGION THAT FOCUS ON PROMOTING LAND HEALTH
CO WHITE RIVER RANGELAND MONITORING AND IMPROVEMENTS

SAN JUAN SWCD WILL IMPLEMENT WATERSHED SCALE MONITORING AND RESTORATION ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE WATERSHED AND RANGELAND HEALTH IN THE SAN JUAN BASIN  VEGETATION TREATMENTS WILL REDUCE HAZARDOUS FUELS LOAD, COMBAT BRUSH ENCROACHMENT, AND RESTORE GRASSLANDS FOR THE BENEFIT OF LIVESTOCK, WILDLIFE, AND WATERSHED HEALTH  EROSION CONTROL STRUCTURES WILL BE INSTALLED TO TRAP SEDIMENT, PROTECT INFRASTRUCTURE AND CULTURAL RESOURCES, RECLAIM UNNEEDED ROADS, AND INCREASE WATER AVAILABILITY FOR LIVESTOCK AND WILDLIFE  MONITORING ACTIVITIES WILL FOCUS ON SUCCESS OF VEGETATION TREATMENTS, AND PILOT WATERSHED ASSESSMENTS LOOKING AT SALINITY REDUCTIONS AND ECOLOGICAL SITE DESCRIPTIONS  RANGELANDS PROJECTS WILL BENEFIT GRAZING, ENDANGERED SPECIES, RECREATION, CULTURAL RESOURCES, AND SOIL HEALTH  THE AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT LOCAL JOBS AND CONTRACTORS, STRENGTHEN RELATIONSHIPS WITH ADJACENT TRIBAL NATIONS, AND PROVIDE IMPORTANT CONSERVATION WORK ON PUBLIC LANDS THAT HAVE BEEN DEGRADED
AK ECOLOGICAL SUPPORT OF VEGETATION MONITORING AND RECLAMATION ACTIVITIES

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ACCURATE AND PRECISE MEASURED SOIL PROPERTIES AT BLM AIM SITES  THIS PROJECTWILL ALSO PROVIDE BLM FIELD OFFICE SPECIFIC SOIL LIBRARIES AND TRAINING MATERIALS FOR BLM STAFF TO IDENTIFYAND DESCRIBE COMMON SOILS IN THEIR FIELD OFFICE THIS PROJECT WILL FURTHER DOI PRIORITIES BY PROVIDING MEASURED SOIL PROPERTIES THAT ARE CONSISTENTLYMEASURED THUS MAKING THEM COMPARABLE FOR USE AS COMMON INDICATORS TO ENABLE UNBIASED ANALYSIS  THISPROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE LOCALLY SPECIFIC SOILS TRAINING FOR ALL BLM STAFF THIS PROJECT WILL HELP INFORM THE APPROPRIATE MANAGEMENT OF RANGELAND AND SOIL RESOURCES AND ALSOSUPPORT A VARIETY OF AUTHORIZATIONS FOR SUCH THINGS AS ENDANGERED AND SPECIAL STATUS SPECIES RECOVERY,GRAZING OF DOMESTIC LIVESTOCK, RECREATION, FOREST MANAGEMENT, HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION, AND POST FIRE REHABILITATION THE PROVISION OF ACCURATELY MEASURED SOIL PROPERTIES WILL STRENGTHEN ROBUST MANAGEMENT DECISIONS WHICHWILL BENEFIT PUBLIC USE OF BLM LANDS  THIS RESEARCH WILL ALSO PROVIDE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE TRAINING RESOURCESFOR DESCRIBING COMMON SOIL TYPES ACROSS BLM ADMINISTERED LANDS IN NM  THIS IS INFORMATION NOTCURRENTLY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AND PROVIDING THESE TRAINING RESOURCES VIA WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC BYREDUCING BARRIERS TO ACCESS THIS INFORMATION

NATIONAL FISH AND WILDLIFE FOUNDATION  NFWF  RESPECTFULLY REQUESTS  5,000,000 IN FUNDING FOR A NEW PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN NFWF AND BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT  BLM  NEW MEXICO THAT SUPPORTS THE RESTORE NEW MEXICO PROGRAMS S GOALS OF RESTORING AND MAINTAINING RANGELANDS  NFWF HAS ESTABLISHED LANDSCAPE SCALE CONSERVATION PROGRAMS AROUND THE COUNTRY MANY OF WHICH HAVE OVERLAPPING GEOGRAPHIES WITH BLM LANDS, SHARED PRIORITIES WITH BLM, AND HISTORICAL INCLUSION OF BLM AS A KEY PARTNER DRIVEN BY SCIENCE BASED GOALS, AND FOR MANY OF THE GEOGRAPHIES, BUSINESS PLANS  NFWF S PROGRAMS BRING TOGETHER FEDERAL AND NON FEDERAL PARTNERS AND PRIORITIES TO GENERATE REQUESTS FOR PROPOSALS  RFPS  THAT LEVERAGE PARTNER RESOURCES, SOLICIT TARGETED PROJECTS, AND GENERATE ROBUST ANNUAL GRANT SLATES TRACKED THROUGH METRICS AND SCORECARDS FOR THIS FY22 PARTNERSHIP, BLM AND NFWF WILL COORDINATE ON AND UTILIZE NFWF S  1  SOUTHWEST RIVERS HEADWATERS PROGRAM,  2  PECOS WATERSHED CONSERVATION INITIATIVE,  3  WESTERN BIG GAME SEASONAL HABITAT AND MIGRATION CORRIDORS FUND, AND  4  THE SOUTHERN PLAINS GRASSLAND PROGRAM 2023 RFPS TO SOLICIT COMPETITIVE PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS SHARED BLM NFWF CONSERVATION PRIORITIES  NFWF WILL WORK WITH BLM TO DETERMINE FUNDING ALLOCATIONS ACROSS EACH NFWF PROGRAM, ENSURE BLM S PRIORITIES ARE CAPTURED IN EACH RFP, WILL HAVE BLM PARTICIPATE IN THE REVIEW COMMITTEES AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR PROJECT FUNDING, AND WILL ENSURE THAT BLM FUNDS ONLY GO TO PROJECTS SUPPORTED BY THE AGENCY  THIS PARTNERSHIP WILL PRIMARILY FUND PROJECTS THAT INVOLVE VEGETATION RESTORATION TREATMENTS, INVASIVE SPECIES REMOVAL, AND EROSION CONTROL EACH OF THESE NFWF PROGRAMS PROPOSED FOR THIS PARTNERSHIP CONTAIN A MIX OF FEDERAL AND NON FEDERAL PARTNERS  NFWF WILL LEVERAGE FUNDING FROM THESE PARTNERSHIPS AND SUBRECIPIENT MATCHING FUNDS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES TO BLM S FUNDS  SOUTHWEST RIVERS HEADWATERS FUNDING PARTNERS INCLUDE BLM, FWS, USFS, AND THE TRINCHERA BALANCE FOUNDATION  THE PECOS WATERSHED CONSERVATION INITIATIVE CONTAINS FUNDING FROM APACHE, BLM, CHEVRON, CONOCOPHILLIPS, CORTEVA AGRISCIENCE, OCCIDENTAL, FWS, AND XTO ENERGY, AND USDA NRCS  THE BIG GAME MIGRATIONS FUND INCLUDES FUNDING PARTNERS WITH BEZOS EARTH FUND, BNSF, BLM, CONOCOPHILLIPS, DOI, MICROSOFT, FWS, USFS, AND USDA NRCS  THE SOUTHERN PLAINS GRASSLAND PROGRAM CONTAINS FUNDING FROM BURGER KING, CARGILL, SYSCO, AND USDA NRCS NFWF WILL REMOVE ADMINISTRATIVE BURDEN FROM BLM BY UTILIZING NFWF S GRANTS MANAGEMENT EXPERTISE AND PROCESSES TO ESTABLISH SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS AND MONITORING OF SUBRECIPIENT OUTCOMES  OVERALL, NFWF WILL HELP BRING OTHER RESOURCES TO BLM INTERESTS, CREATE A STREAMLINED PROCESS FOR FUNDING TARGETED PROPOSALS ACROSS SELECT GEOGRAPHIES, AND MANAGE REPORTING TO BLM ACROSS SUBRECIPIENT PROJECT DELIVERABLES AND METRICS THIS APPROACH WILL NOT ONLY PRODUCE THE STRONGEST PROJECTS TARGETED TO SPECIFIC SCIENCE BASED OUTCOMES, BUT WILL BE DRIVEN AROUND EFFORTS THAT PROTECT BIODIVERSITY, CONSERVE AND RESTORE PRIORITY HABITATS, AND PROMOTE RESILIENCE TO CLIMATE CHANGE AND ENVIRONMENTAL STRESSORS

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO RESTORE AND REHABILITATE RANGELAND IN SOUTHERN NEW MEXICO IN ORDER TO RESTORE HABITAT FOR NATIVE AND DOMESTIC SPECIES  RESTORATION AND REHABILITATION OF RANGELANDS WILL ACCOMPLISH MANY THINGS SUCH AS HEALTHIER HABITATS FOR NATIVE AND DOMESTIC SPECIES, REDUCTION OF HABITAT FRAGMENTATION, WATERSHED RESTORATION WHICH WILL INCREASE WATER INFILTRATION THAT WILL HELP PREVENT FLOODING, STABILIZATION AND REHABILITATION OF DISTURBED AREAS, EROSION CONTROL DUE TO DISTURBED AREAS ETC  RANGELAND RESTORATION BEGINS WITH TREATMENT OF INVASIVE AND NOXIOUS WEEDS WHICH HAVE CHOKED OUT NATIVE GRASSLANDS  MUCH OF THE LANDSCAPE WILL REBOUND WITH HEALTHY GRASSLAND UPON THE REMOVAL OF WEEDS, SOME AREAS WILL REQUIRE ENHANCEMENT OF HABITATS THROUGH INTRODUCTION OF NATIVE PLANTS AND SEED  ANOTHER IMPORTANT COMPONENT OF RANGELAND REHABILITATION IS EDUCATING THE PUBLIC REGARDING INVASIVE AND NOXIOUS PLANT MANAGEMENT  THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT AND DISSEMINATION OF MATERIALS SUCH AS BROCHURES AND CALENDARS IDENTIFYING WEED SPECIES AND THE NEED FOR CONTROLLING THEM, MAINTENANCE AND UPDATING OF THE COMPREHENSIVE PLANT INVENTORY OF THE COOPERATIVE WEED MANAGEMENT AREA TO INCLUDE EXTENT OF INFESTATIONS, KEEPING THE INTERACTIVE MAPPING PAGE OF THE OTERO SWCD WEBSITE UPDATED WITH PHOTOS AND ACREAGES AS TREATMENTS ARE BEING COMPLETED  ALSO INCLUDED IN THIS AGREEMENT WILL BE INVENTORYING AND SURVEYING INFESTED AREAS, INCLUDING DISCOVERY OF ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES WHICH WOULD REQUIRE CLEARANCES OR SPECIAL TREATMENTS, MONITORING TREATED AREAS TO ASSESS EFFICACY OF TREATMENTS AND COORDINATION OF MULTI JURISDICTIONAL AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS, RESPONSE PLANS TO INFESTATIONS THIS PROJECT BENEFITS THE PUBLIC THROUGH PROVIDING HABITAT IMPROVEMENT ON PUBLIC LANDS USED FOR HUNTING, CAMPING, AND HIKING BY REDUCING THE COMPETITION FOR NATIVE GRASSES AND OTHER FORAGE FOR GRAZING  THE BLM WILL BENEFIT THROUGH ASSISTANCE WITH THEIR RANGELAND MANAGEMENT PROGRAM ON PUBLIC LANDS, INCREASED HABITAT AND WATERSHED HEALTH, AND FUEL LOAD REDUCTION THROUGH CONTROL AND MANAGEMENT OF INVASIVE SPECIES AND NOXIOUS WEEDS ANNUAL MILESTONES FOR PROPOSED INFESTATION   TREATMENTS WILL INCLUDE APPROXIMATELY 2,000 ACRES OF GROUND TREATMENT   AND MONITORING MONTHLY PARTNER STAKEHOLDER MEETINGS, ATTENDED   BY PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS BLM,   NATURAL RESOURCES CONSERVATION SERVICE, UNITED STATES   FOREST SERVICE, NEW   MEXICO STATE LAND OFFICE, NEW MEXICO DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, NEW MEXICO DEPARTMENT OF GAME AND FISH AND NEW MEXICO ASSOCIATION OF   CONSERVATION DISTRICTS APPROXIMATELY 25 LANDOWNER COST SHARE   AGREEMENTS

FOCUS ON ENHANCEMENTS TO THE MANAGEMENT OF ACTIVE GRASSLAND, RANGELAND, AND WILDLIFE HABITATRESTORATION, AS WELL AS EROSION CONTROL METHODS  METHODS SUCH AS VEGETATION MANAGEMENT, CONTROL OF INVASIVE AND EXOTICSPECIES  TAMARISK , EROSION SALINITY CONTROL, AND RIPARIAN RESTORATION WILL AID IN IMPROVING RANGELAND HEALTH, WILDLIFE HABITAT,AND RIPARIAN ECOSYSTEMS RESILIENCY TO WATER SURFACE FLOW  EROSION POTENTIAL , AS WELL AS REDUCE SUSCEPTIBILITY TO WILDFIRE,DISEASE, AND DROUGHT

A FIELD CREW OF 4 WILL CONDUCT SCHEDULED 10-YEAR REMONITORING OF REINDEER EXCLOSURE SITES ON THE SEWARD PENINSULA TO ASSESS GRAZING IMPACT AND SUPPORT MANAGEMENT DECISIONS OF REINDEER GRAZING LEASES. PROJECT SCOPE IS FOR 5 DAYS OF HELICOPTER-ACCESSED FIELD WORK BASED IN NOME IN THE SUMMER OF 2022, VISITING 10-12 OF THE SITES THIS YEAR. IN THE SUMMER OF 2023, THE REMAINING 12 SITES WILL BE COMPLETED. CREW WILL FOLLOW PROTOCOL ESTABLISHED BY THE REINDEER RESEARCH PROGRAM, WHICH INCLUDES VEGETATION AND LICHEN ASSESSMENT AND DETAILED PHOTO DOCUMENT AND ANALYSIS FOR PERCENT COVER. IN ADDITION, EXCLOSURE FENCES WILL BE INSPECTED AND MAINTAINED TO THE BEST OF THE CREW'S ABILITY. THESE PLOTS WERE ESTABLISHED IN 2011. THIS WILL EXECUTE THE FIRST SCHEDULED 10-YEAR REMEASUREMENT OF THESE EXCLOSURE SITES. MONITORING OF LICHEN AND VEGETATION HEALTH AND ABUNDANCE IS IMPORTANT TO THE SUSTAINABLE MANAGEMENT OF SEWARD PENINSULA REINDEER HERDS. THUS, THE CONTINUATION OF THIS STANDARD COMPREHENSIVE MONITORING PROGRAM IS NEEDED TO EVALUATE RANGE UTILIZATION AND SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT OF ADAPTIVE AND SUSTAINABLE HERDING PRACTICES IN THIS CHALLENGING REMOTE ENVIRONMENT.
